meanings.definition: Perceptible by touch; capable of being touched or felt.
meanings.sent1: The soft fur of the kitten was tangibly smooth to the touch.
meanings.sent2: The new toy had a tangibly rough texture that could be felt easily.
meanings.sent3: The idea of a flying elephant is as tangibly real as a unicorn.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness was tangibly warm, like a cozy blanket on a cold day.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of freshly baked cookies was tangibly inviting, drawing everyone to the kitchen.

meanings.definition: Clearly real or actual; able to be physically experienced or demonstrated.
meanings.sent1: The excitement in the air was tangibly electric, making everyone smile.
meanings.sent2: The tension in the room was tangibly thick, almost suffocating.
meanings.sent3: The idea of a talking dog seemed tangibly possible in that silly movie.
meanings.sent4: His determination was tangibly solid, like a mountain that couldn't be moved.
meanings.sent5: The beauty of the sunset was tangibly breathtaking, painting the sky in vibrant colors.
